Right now, near you, someone needs blood. Not just any blood, a perfect match. That’s why I donate.  Join me in a global movement and donate blood now.  You could save a life. BE THE 1 Donor BE THE 1 Donor Did you know that 1 blood donation can save up to 3 lives?

This holiday season, I give thanks for what I have and am reminded of those who aren’t so fortunate. Let’s make this new year a little brighter for kids in need around the world.  Let’s all help Save the Children. http://bit.ly/1qRf6sb Timeline Photos

Nearly 10 years ago, I met brave Martunis, now 18, who survived the Indian Ocean #tsunami. A news crew found him alone on a beach in Banda Aceh.  I honor those who died, admire the strength of the children who survived and give thanks to everyone who helped.  Save the Children

Great to meet these brave NYC kids after the friendly against Ireland. They survived Superstorm Sandy and stayed strong! With the help of Save the Children these kids are now helping other communities. Timeline Photos

Ahmed, 16, is a Syrian refugee. He dreams of becoming a footballer. Save the Children and I stand with Ahmed and #withSyria whose children deserve a better tomorrow. http://bit.ly/1kAqYKR

Guillermo, Miguel, Jorge and Vítor are an inspiration and a clear proof that it’s worth fighting. It was a privilege to meet these brave kids. Being a bone marrow donor only involves collecting blood, nothing else - a simple gesture that can save a life. I've done it and would do it again. It doesn’t cost anything and can give hope to those who need it most. Because leukemia exists and does not choose gender, age or race. Untitled Album

Well done to all the kids in Mozambique who ran in Save the Children’s relay marathon last month. Kids helping kids and staying fit by running. That’s a winning combination. Instagram savethechildren's photo on Instagram

I was informed that “The Sun” newspaper, faithful to its editorial line, will publish an article where is given voice to a so called Andressa, someone seeking the limelight on my account. And I wonder why this happens one day before a very important game for my team… Deeply outraged by a situation intended, in vain, to afect my personal life, I just want to clarify that I was in fact at the Hotel Villa Magna on April 22nd giving an interview to Manu Sainz, something the reporter himself is able to corroborate. Everything else is pure fiction and forgery.

Foi em 20 de Agosto de 2003, frente ao Cazaquistão, que vesti pela primeira vez a camisola da nossa Selecção. Foi um dos momentos mais marcantes da minha vida e um percurso que muito me orgulha pelo que todos juntos, conseguimos. Na terça-feira, farei a minha centésima internacionalização junto do nosso publico e apenas com a vitória em mente. Gostaria de agradecer a todos os que me ajudaram a chegar até aqui e contar com o estádio cheio a apoiar a nossa Selecção. Timeline Photos

Dois jogos, seis pontos. Missão cumprida. Ontem podíamos ter marcado mais golos, mas também é verdade que o Azerbaijão complicou muito a nossa tarefa. Seja como for, o resultado desta jornada dupla foi muito positivo e chegou, agora, o momento de voltar ao clube e de pensar exclusivamente no meu clube. 
 
Reafirmo, sem estar preocupado com contratos, que estou unicamente concentrado em vencer todos os jogos e todos os troféus em disputa na imprescindível companhia dos meus companheiros e de todos os madridistas.
Em casa, com amigos ou no estádio....amanhã estamos todos juntos. Força Portugal! Timeline Photos
